bug.author: songyzh
bug.summary: utils.kmeans_targets - RuntimeError: The size of tensor a (70165) must match the size of tensor b (2) at non-singleton dimension 2
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
throws "RuntimeError: The size of tensor a (70165) must match the size of tensor b (2) at non-singleton dimension 2" when calling kmeans_targets <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
python -c "from utils import utils; utils.kmeans_targets(path='data/custom/train.txt', img_size=832)" <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
output anchors <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
linux, on master(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/cdc382e3131194c1e211b595e646e3943bd23c69>cdc382e</denchmark-link> )

comments.comment: FYI: same command on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/adc2663fe70aee3bb286dc79e9fe6eec20a47f87>adc2663</denchmark-link> is ok

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/songyzh>@songyzh</denchmark-link> thanks for the bug report! We were able to reproduce this issue, and discovered that it was related to an IOU function upgrade we did. This has been fixed now in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/b636f7f7ab66bd40d8f86f60e2fe31d8c0d54ea6>b636f7f</denchmark-link> . Please git pull and try again.
